title: Canadian cannabis bigwig drops Althea stake
text:
Stockbroker PAC Partners is putting together a group of investors to buy a 16 per cent stake in local medicinal cannabis company Althea.

Street Talk understands PAC was seeking funds to buy the 37 million Althea shares at 40¢ each on Wednesday morning.

Young Rich Lister and Althea head Joshua Fegan. Josh Robenstone

The price was at a 27 per cent discount to Althea's last traded price of 53¢.

It is understood PAC is seeking fund managers to buy the stake owned by Canadian cannabis company Aphria, which had been selling on market in recent days.

As at July 31, according to Althea's annual report, Aphria held 50.8 million shares in the company.
description: Stockbroker PAC Partners is believed to be putting together a group of investors to buy a 16 per cent stake in local medicinal cannabis company Althea.
